bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:08): But the phone lines are jammed

f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e (21:08): Also in Boston? Is that far away from NYC?
987eb261fdab9a9d6608941f285a0b61 (21:09): here in VA, defaintely felt that 5.8

0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:09): 's Twitter started beeping
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (21:10): f4bfe7806ad6735f1dab2f9222fc539e: It's about a 4hr drive from NYC.  I have no idea what happened there, though.
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:21): i'm trying to build a mobile-first site
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:22): but all the cases to design/develop for gets intimidating, me being rather noobish
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:25): esp iPhone 4 vs older iPhones; don't want things too small on the hi-res screen

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:30): hello, folks‚Ä¶ does anyone know if some nifty new CSS feature would allow me to place an icon over an <img> element, without adding the icon via another <img>?
30713a44e8df7587c64b4dfd1c09d9d2 (21:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/sel_before.asp
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:31): haven't heard of anything like that... don't think
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:31): http://w3fools.com/
30713a44e8df7587c64b4dfd1c09d9d2 (21:32): it might not work with arbitrary code tho
30713a44e8df7587c64b4dfd1c09d9d2 (21:32): better use javascript and dom to insert those icons
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:32): I'm thinking something that takes a @background-image and moves it up in the z-index
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:33): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: seems to me you'd still have to have a separate element
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:34): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: separate element needed, unless to the whole image using <div>
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:34): have background-image and border-image
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:34): and the border-image is the icon
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:34): or something along the lines
fb4c03b13a0b5a224f8b0b82acf718f9 (21:34): but img is more semantic no?
30713a44e8df7587c64b4dfd1c09d9d2 (21:35): or use canvas and paint those in correct order
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:35): "Whenever I hear of semantics... I release the safety catch of my Browning!"
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:37): http://www.tjkdesign.com/articles/png_overlay_with_no_extra_markup.asp is interesting, but too hacky
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:38): ok, guess there's no way to do it with CSS alone
